results.title: Sons of Matthew
results.creator_credit: Expeditionary Films, Charles Chauvel and Elsa Chauvel
results.brief_description: This is the story of three generations of the O’Riordan family, battling bushfire, drought and cyclone to settle rugged frontier land. Based on the true story of the O’Reilly family, it took two years to make this film in the wild mountain terrain of southeastern Queensland. In this film Charles Chauvel realises his romantic vision of Australians as spirited rural people conquering a hostile land. Its power lies in the strong performances of the cast and in the striking landscape, which frames the human and elemental conflicts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Expeditionary Films, Charles Chauvel and Elsa Chauvel

results.title: Sons and lovers 'the dark forest' [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Terry Monagle, Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and David Zweck
results.brief_description: Terry Monagle leads a discussion with a group of students in a program designed to aid understanding of the main characters of D H Lawrence’s novel in the context of the themes which concerned Lawrence in the writing of the novel.

results.title: Sonny Terry: shoutin' the blues
results.brief_description: Blind blues musician, Sonny Terry, performs a highly innovative piece on the harmonica. Filmed and recorded at the Broadway Motel, Oakland, California in 1969. (A useful compliment to ‘Chicago Blues’ title code: 507696)

results.title: Songs to remember
results.brief_description: A collection of late 1940s songs with nostalgic visuals of the “good old times” and big band music. Songs include ‘Take me out to the ballgame’ (Men and Maids of Melody), ‘The sidewalks of New York’ (Michael Bartlett) and ‘In the good old summertime’ (Men and Maids of Melody).

results.title: Songs of the range
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films

results.title: Songs of Scotland
results.creator_credit: International Film Associates, Films of Scotland, Laurence Henson and Edward McConnell
results.brief_description: An interpretation of familiar ballads and folk songs of Scotland set against scenes from the Outer Hebrides to Loch Lomond and the city streets of Glasgow. The songs include Kishmuil’s Gallery, Loch Lomond, and John Anderson My Jo.

results.title: Songs of love
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Contains the following love songs: Blue Danube; Romance; Stardust; Two guitars and dark eyes; Love’s own sweet song; Miss you; A nightingale sang in Berkeley Square; It was wonderful then; Isn’t that just like love; It all comes back to me now. Songs performed by The Melody Maids, Gene Grounds and Charles Baron. Recorded by Bobby Sherwood and his Orchestra. Film originally titled “In love with a song”, produced by Cameo Productions in 1941 - director, Roy Mack; producer, Sam Coslow.
